intro: Topobea tetramera, commonly known as the four-leafed bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and mustard. The plant is characterized by its small, rounded leaves and clusters of four-petaled white flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along dry streambeds. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and evolutionary studies.
